results.title: The Chase
results.creator_credit: Shaun Elstob, Anutaro Tantraporn, John Sharpe, Gillian Morisson and Sharon Parker
results.brief_description: A man snatches a baby off its mother as she leaves a train station. Distraught, she pursues and then attacks him. But how maternal are her instincts to protect her ‘bundle of joy’?

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: Apoidea
results.brief_description: Computer animation about the evolution of a lily-like plant species on a watery planet. When the plants burst into bloom a swarm of metallic insects move in to fertilise its flowers. A violent ballet between insect and plant ensues.

results.title: Eye of fire
results.brief_description: A gas leak in an underwater pipeline caused an oceanic fireball dubbed ‘The Eye of Fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico. The state owned company is investigating the causes.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title_for_label: ‘Eye of fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In horrific scenes that seemed more like footage from an action movie than the real world, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The huge fireball blazing across the sea surface was caused by a gas leak from an underwater pipeline, which social media users dubbed ‘the eye of fire’. The video was shared across the internet as further evidence of the environmental tolls of capitalism and the irresponsibility of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In astonishing scenes, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The fireball blazing across the sea surface, dubbed the ‘eye of fire’ by social media users, was caused by an underwater gas leak from a pipeline. The video spread across the internet as further evidence of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: [Black Knight]
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of the British “Black Knight” rocket test vehicle and its use in high speed flight and ballistic missile research. The elements of construction, ground support equipment, propulsion, guidance and instrumentation are discussed. Tests and launching preparations at Australia’s Woomera Range follow, closing with a night-firing sequence. NB: No opening or closing credits

results.title: The Blue streak rocket
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and George Grafton Green
results.brief_description: The Blue Streak Rocket is the first stage in the development of a rocket which will help boost a one ton satellite, of the European Launcher Development Organisation, into orbit three hundred miles high. Shows the static test in England and the launching at Woomera.

results.title: Green Fingers: Looking After Lemons
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Looking After Lemons’, gardener Rod Cantrill shows ways to look after the popular lemon tree.

The narrator points out various issues that can afflict them including collar rot, leaf yellowing, leaf fall, and pests and diseases, while Cantrill works on lemon trees in a beautiful orchard. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Green Fingers: Indoor Plants
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
